betsy.vocab

Class Vocab

  • java.lang.Object
    • betsy.vocab.Vocab

  • public class Vocab
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of methods used for analyzing single words.
    Author:
    jacob

      • replaceContractions

        public static java.lang.String[] replaceContractions(java.lang.String[] words)
        Given an array of words, produce a new array with the contraction words (like "don't") replaced with their expanded form ("do not").
        Parameters:
        words - the words with potential contractions to replace
        Returns:
        a new array of words with contractions replaced with multiple words.

        public static NounInfo getNoun(java.lang.String s,
                               Tag tag)
        Get the WordInfo for a noun word.
        Parameters:
        s - the word
        tag - the tag given by the parser -- helps with determining the context of the word
        Returns:
        the WordInfo for the word

      • swapPronoun

        public static java.lang.String swapPronoun(java.lang.String pronoun)
        If the given word is a pronoun like "you" or "yourself", swap it with "me" or "myself". Pronouns like "she" or "i" become their canonical forms, "her" or "me".
        Parameters:
        pronoun - the word to check
        Returns:
        the word, possibly swapped with other pronouns

      • pronounPossessor

        public static java.lang.String pronounPossessor(java.lang.String pronoun)
        If the given word is a possessive pronoun like "my", swap it as in swapPronoun() and replace it with the possessor moun of the word ("me").
        Parameters:
        pronoun - the word to check
        Returns:
        the word, possibly swapped with other pronouns

      • isAWhWord

        public static boolean isAWhWord(java.lang.String word)
        Check if the word is a "WH" question word: who, what, when, where, why, how, which, whom, whose.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to check
        Returns:
        true if it is a question word

      • makePlural

        public static java.lang.String makePlural(java.lang.String noun)
        Make a singular noun plural, using a set of rules that works for most nouns, but not all.
        Parameters:
        noun - the singular form of the noun
        Returns:
        the noun's plural form

      • isConsonant

        public static boolean isConsonant(char c)
        Check if the character is a consonant: a, e, i, o, or u.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to check
        Returns:
        true if it is a consonant

      • makePossessive

        public static java.lang.String makePossessive(java.lang.String noun)
        Make a noun possessive (without swapping it). For example, "me" becomes "my," "him" becomes "her," and "Joe" becomes "Joe's".
        Parameters:
        noun - the pronoun to make possessive
        Returns:
        the possessive form of the noun

      • makePronounSubject

        public static java.lang.String makePronounSubject(java.lang.String pronoun)
        Some pronouns change when they are the subject of the sentence. "Me" becomes "I," "him" becomes "he," etc. This changes a pronoun to make it grammatically correct in the subject of a sentence.
        Parameters:
        pronoun - the word to check
        Returns:
        a version of the word that is more grammatically correct when used in the subject of a sentence.

      • conjugateVerb

        public static java.lang.String conjugateVerb(java.lang.String verb,
                                             java.lang.String tenseTime,
                                             java.lang.String tenseFrame)
        Change a verb to be in a given tense. This is done using a set of rules or lists of common verbs and their tenses.
        Parameters:
        verb - the verb in its base form (present, simple tense)
        tenseTime - the time of the verb tense: "PAST", "PRESENT", "FUTURE", or "GENERIC" generic
        tenseFrame - the frame of the verb tense: "SIMPLE", "PERFECT", "CONTINUOUS", or "PERFECT_CONTINUOUS"
        Returns:
        the verb word, in the given tense

      • makeComparative

        public static java.lang.String makeComparative(java.lang.String adjective)
        Make an adjective or adverb comparative, like "fast" -> "faster". This method cheats and just returns things like "more fast."
        Parameters:
        adjective - the adjective or adverb to make comparative
        Returns:
        the comparative form of the word

      • makeSuperlative

        public static java.lang.String makeSuperlative(java.lang.String adjective)
        Make an adjective or adverb superlative, like "fast" -> "fastest". This method cheats and just returns things like "most fast."
        Parameters:
        adjective - the adjective or adverb to make superlative
        Returns:
        the superlative form of the word
